title: Ingestion Pipeline: Phase 2 - Context & Performance
description: Second phase focusing on context engineering for long articles, parallel processing, and author enrichment. Target: 10 hours total effort.

title: Implement context compression for long articles
description:
Apply LangChain context engineering strategies for articles > 3000 words.

**Why:** 87.5% of agent failures are context problems. Truncating at 4000 chars loses critical info.

**How:**
- Summarize long articles before classification (Compress)
- Extract key sections: intro, conclusion, headers (Select)
- Run definition gen on full text, classification on summary (Isolate)

**Source:** LangChain Context Engineering, Weaviate research

**Effort:** 4 hours
**Impact:** Better classification on long-form content

title: Add parallel relationship search
description:
Parallelize relationship discovery using Fast Agentic Search pattern.

**Why:** Relace research shows 4x latency reduction via parallel tool calls.

**How:**
- Replace sequential similarity loop with asyncio.gather
- Process 10-20 resources concurrently
- Aggregate results

**Source:** Relace Fast Agentic Search

**Effort:** 2 hours
**Impact:** 4x faster relationship discovery as KB grows

title: Add author enrichment via GitHub API
description:
Enrich new authors with metadata from GitHub API.

**Why:** Currently author bio/affiliation is often '~'. Manual research is tedious.

**How:**
- If author not in existing_authors, search GitHub
- Extract: company, bio, location, twitter handle
- Populate authors.yaml fields automatically

**Effort:** 4 hours
**Impact:** Richer author metadata without manual research

title: Implement lazy DSPy module loading
description:
Apply Anthropic Tool Search pattern to reduce token consumption.

**Why:** Loading all 4 DSPy modules consumes tokens even when not needed.

**How:**
- Quick URL (video, simple blog) → Only classifier + ID generator
- Complex article → Full pipeline
- Known author → Skip author extraction

**Source:** Anthropic Advanced Tool Use (85% token reduction)

**Effort:** 3 hours
**Impact:** 40-60% token reduction on simple ingestions

title: Add About Me / Resume section
description: Create an about/resume section with bio, contact info, and professional background

title: Ingestion Pipeline: Phase 1 Improvements
description: First phase of ingestion pipeline enhancements focusing on extraction quality, duplicate detection, and batch processing. Target: 4 hours total effort, significant quality improvements.

title: Replace Unstructured with summarize.sh wrapper
description:
Replace ingestion/extractor.py with summarize.sh CLI wrapper for more robust content extraction.

**Why:** summarize.sh handles YouTube transcripts (multiple fallback methods), anti-scraping sites, and produces clean JSON output.

**How:** 
- Install: brew install steipete/tap/summarize
- Wrap CLI in Python subprocess call
- Parse JSON output into ExtractedContent dataclass

**Effort:** 30 min
**Impact:** Better extraction quality, YouTube support

title: Add duplicate detection via embeddings
description:
Before running DSPy classification, check if resource already exists or is semantically similar.

**Why:** Prevents duplicate entries, surfaces related resources for relationship mapping.

**How:**
- Add sentence-transformers dependency
- Embed new content (first 2000 chars)
- Compare against existing resource definitions
- Flag if similarity > 0.85

**Effort:** 2 hours
**Impact:** No more duplicates, automatic relationship suggestions

title: Add batch ingestion from markdown
description:
Add 'ingest.py batch <file.md>' command to process multiple URLs from markdown files.

**Why:** Process entire intake-queue.md in one run instead of 50 individual commands.

**How:**
- Parse markdown for URLs (regex extraction)
- Support formats: bare URL, URL with notes, URL with type hint
- Loop through cmd_add for each URL
- Summary report at end

**Effort:** 1 hour
**Impact:** 10x faster bulk ingestion

title: Add definition quality scoring
description:
Add DSPy module that scores generated definitions for quality.

**Why:** Catch generic/vague definitions before they enter the KB.

**How:**
- New DefinitionQualityCheck signature
- Check: has_scope_boundaries (what it IS NOT)
- Check: has_value_proposition (why it matters)  
- Check: semantic_density (info per word)
- Flag low-quality for human review

**Effort:** 1 hour
**Impact:** Higher quality definitions, less review burden

title: Persist DSPy reasoning to log
description:
Log classification reasoning for debugging bad classifications.

**Why:** OpenAI CoT Monitorability research shows logging reasoning improves error detection.

**How:**
- Add log_classification() function
- Store: url, domain, reasoning, confidence, timestamp
- Write to queue/classification_log.jsonl

**Effort:** 30 min
**Impact:** Debug wrong classifications, improve prompts over time

title: Add Resource Graph Visualizer
description: Implement interactive knowledge graph visualization similar to dbt-agent kg-visualization.html for browsing all resources

title: Ingestion Pipeline: Phase 3 - Advanced Features
description: Third phase focusing on KB quality testing, experiential learning, and packaging as Claude Skill. Target: 2-3 days total effort.

title: Implement Semiosis-style KB quality testing
description:
Build evaluation framework measuring KB effectiveness.

**Why:** We have 61 resources but don't know if they're useful, redundant, or have gaps.

**Metrics to track:**
- Completeness: Do resources cover the domain adequately?
- Redundancy: Which resources overlap and could be merged?
- Critical boundaries: Which resources are essential vs nice-to-have?

**How:**
- Create test queries for each domain
- Run LLM against KB, measure retrieval quality
- Identify gaps and redundancies

**Source:** Semiosis framework

**Effort:** 2 days
**Impact:** Systematic KB quality improvement

title: Add experiential learning from successful classifications
description:
Store successful high-confidence classifications for few-shot learning.

**Why:** Spark paper shows small models benefit most from shared memory (+0.66 pts).

**How:**
- Store successful ingestions (confidence > 0.9) in history
- When new resource is similar to past success, use as few-shot example
- Inject into DSPy classification prompt

**Source:** Spark: Shared Memory for Coding Agents (arXiv)

**Effort:** 1 day
**Impact:** Classification improves over time as pipeline learns patterns

title: Package ingestion pipeline as Claude Code Skill
description:
Package entire ingestion flow as a Claude Code Skill for easy invocation.

**Why:** 'Tool Search is Dead, Long Live Skills' - skills bundle instructions + tools.

**How:**
- Create .claude/skills/kb-ingestion/SKILL.md
- Move ingestion/ modules into skill
- Add MCP tool definitions if needed

**Result:** Users say 'ingest this URL' and skill handles everything.

**Source:** agentskills.io, nicolaygerold.com

**Effort:** 3 hours
**Impact:** Seamless ingestion from any Claude Code session

title: Integrate CocoIndex for incremental processing and graph export
description:
Use CocoIndex for smart incremental processing and knowledge graph visualization.

**Why:** CocoIndex handles change detection and graph database export elegantly.

**Capabilities:**
- Only process changed/new URLs (1% churn = 1% processing)
- Export resource relationships to Neo4j
- Query: 'What resources reference X?', 'Author collaboration graph'

**Source:** cocoindex.io

**Effort:** 1 day
**Impact:** Visual knowledge graph, efficient reprocessing
